title: Manual
text: Tools analysis RT-qPCR gene expression data using ΔCt\Delta Ct ΔΔCt\Delta\Delta Ct methods, including t-tests ANOVA models, publication-ready visualizations. package implements general calculation method adopted Ganger et al. (2017) Taylor et al. (2019), covering Livak Pfaffl methods. See calculation method details.

title: Manual
text: relative expression analysis (using TTEST_DDCt, WILCOX_DDCt, ANOVA_DCt, ANOVA_DDCt functions), amplification efficiency (E) Ct Cq values (mean technical replicates) used input table. E values available use ‘2’ instead representing complete primer amplification efficiency. input data table include following columns left wright: Experimental condition columns (one block available NOTE 1) Replicates information (biological replicates subjects; see NOTE 2, NOTE 3) Target genes efficiency Ct values (pair column gene). Reference genes efficiency Ct values (pair column gene) NOTE 4. package supports one target reference gene(s), supplied efficiency–Ct column pairs. Reference gene columns must always appear last. Two sample input data sets presented .  blocking factor, corresponding block columns omitted. However, column biological replicates (may named “Rep”, “id”, similar) always required.

title: Manual
text: Single factor experiment two levels (e.g. Control Treatment): TTEST_DDCt() function used relative expression analysis treatment condition compared control condition. paired unpaired experimental designs supported. data doesn’t follow t.test assumptions, WILCOX_DDCt() function can used instead. Single factor experiment two levels, multi-factor experiments: cases, ANOVA_DDCt() ANOVA_DCt() functions used analysis qPCR data. default, statistical analysis performed based uni- multi-factorial Completely Randomized Design (CRD) Randomized Complete Block Design (RCBD) design based numOfFactors availability block. However, optional custom model formula character string can supplied functions. provided, overrides default formula (uni- multi-factorial CRD RCBD design). formula uses wDCt response variable (wDCt automatically created function). mixed models, include random effects using lmer syntax (e.g., wDCt ~ Treatment + (1 | id)). sample common models can used.

title: Manual
text: CRD, RCBD, factorial experiments arranged either CRD RCBD designs, need explicitly define model. package automatically selects appropriate model based provided arguments. model specified, default model used printed along output expression table.

title: Manual
text: Sometime groups independent paired (Repeated measure experiments). Examples: 1) Analyzing gene expression different time points, treatment biological replicate; 2) Analyzing gene expression two tissue types within organism. analysis types, two time points, can use TTEST_DDCt argument paired = TRUE; ANOVA_DDCt (two time points) repeated measure model wDCt ~ Treatment + ( 1 | id) wDCt ~ Treatment + ( 1 | Rep).

title: Manual
text: Relative expression analysis can done using ΔΔCt\Delta\Delta Ct ΔCt\Delta Ct methods different functions (.e. TTEST_DDCt, WILCOX_DDCt, ANOVA_DDCt(), ANOVA_DCt()). examples expression analysis using ΔΔCt\Delta\Delta Ct method.
code: data1 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_Yuan2006PMCBioinf.csv", package = "rtpcr")) data1       Con r target target_Ct Actin Actin_Ct   control 1   1.88  21.13000  1.67 20.70333   control 2   1.88  21.55667  1.67 20.35000   control 3   1.88  21.33000  1.67 20.75333 treatment 1   1.88  22.09000  1.67 20.24333 treatment 2   1.88  22.69667  1.67 20.54000 treatment 3   1.88  23.05333  1.67 20.50000  # Anova analysis ANOVA_DDCt(   data1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL)   # An example of a properly arranged dataset from a repeated-measures experiment. data2 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_repeated_measure_1.csv", package = "rtpcr")) data2 time    id  E_Target    Ct_target   E_Ref      Ct_Ref    1     1      2       18.92   2   32.77    1     2      2       15.82   2   32.45    1     3      2       19.84   2   31.62    2     1      2       19.46   2   33.03    2     2      2       17.56   2   33.24    2     3      2       19.74   2   32.08    3     1      2       15.73   2   32.95    3     2      2       17.21   2   33.64    3     3      2       18.09   2   33.40  # Repeated measure analysis res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data2,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL, model = wDCt ~ time + (1 | id))   # Paired t.test (equivalent to repeated measure analysis, but not always the same results, due to different calculation methods!) TTEST_DDCt(   data2[1:6,],    numberOfrefGenes = 1,    paired = T)   # Anova analysis data3 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_2factorBlock3ref.csv", package = "rtpcr"))  res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   x = data3,   mainFactor.column = 2,   numOfFactors = 2,   numberOfrefGenes = 3,   block = "block",   analyseAllTarget = TRUE)

title: Manual
text: functions relative expression analysis (including TTEST_DDCt, WILCOX_DDCt, ANOVA_DDCt(), ANOVA_DCt()) return relative expression table include fold change corresponding statistics. output ANOVA_DDCt(), ANOVA_DCt() also include default user defined lm models, residuals, raw data ANOVA table gene. outputs can obtained follow:
code: # Relative expression table for the specified column in the input data: data3 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_2factorBlock3ref.csv", package = "rtpcr"))  res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   x = data3,   mainFactor.column = 2,   numOfFactors = 2,   numberOfrefGenes = 3,   block = "block",   analyseAllTarget = TRUE)  # Relative Expression #   gene contrast     ddCt      RE   log2FC     LCL     UCL      se Lower.se.RE Upper.se.RE Lower.se.log2FC Upper.se.log2FC  pvalue sig # 1   PO       L1  0.00000 1.00000  0.00000 0.00000 0.00000 0.13940     0.90790     1.10144         0.00000         0.00000 1.00000     # 2   PO L2 vs L1 -0.94610 1.92666  0.94610 1.25860 2.94934 0.14499     1.74245     2.13036         0.85564         1.04613 0.00116  ** # 3   PO L3 vs L1 -2.19198 4.56931  2.19198 3.08069 6.77724 0.29402     3.72685     5.60221         1.78783         2.68748 0.00000 *** # 4  NLM       L1  0.00000 1.00000  0.00000 0.00000 0.00000 0.91809     0.52921     1.88962         0.00000         0.00000 1.00000     # 5  NLM L2 vs L1  0.86568 0.54879 -0.86568 0.39830 0.75614 0.36616     0.42577     0.70734        -1.11579        -0.67163 0.00018 *** # 6  NLM L3 vs L1 -1.44341 2.71964  1.44341 1.94670 3.79946 0.17132     2.41511     3.06256         1.28179         1.62542 0.00000 *** #  # The L1 level was used as calibrator. # Note: Using default model for statistical analysis: wDCt ~ block + Concentration * Type    ANOVA_table <- res$perGene$PO$ANOVA_table ANOVA_table  lm <- res$perGene$PO$lm lm  lm_formula <- res$perGene$gene_name$lm_formula lm_formula  residuals <- resid(res$perGene$gene_name$lm) residuals

text: single function plotFactor used produce barplots one- three-factor expression tables.

title: Manual
code: data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_3factor.csv", package = "rtpcr")) #Perform analysis first res <- ANOVA_DCt(   data,   numOfFactors = 3,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL)    df <- res$relativeExpression df # Generate three-factor bar plot plotFactor(   df,   x_col = "SA",          y_col = "log2FC",          group_col = "Type",      facet_col = "Conc",       Lower.se_col = "Lower.se.log2FC",   Upper.se_col = "Upper.se.log2FC",   letters_col = "sig",   letters_d = 0.3,   col_width = 0.7,    dodge_width = 0.7,   fill_colors = c("palegreen3", "skyblue"),   color = "black",   base_size = 14,    alpha = 1,   legend_position = c(0.1, 0.2))

title: Manual
code: # Heffer et al., 2020, PlosOne library(dplyr) df <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_Heffer2020PlosOne.csv", package = "rtpcr"))  res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   df,   numOfFactors = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL)  data <- res$relativeExpression  # Selecting only the first words in 'contrast' column to be used as the x-axis labels. data$contrast <- sub(" .*", "", data$contrast)  plotFactor(   data = data,   x_col = "contrast",   y_col = "RE",   group_col = "contrast",   facet_col = "gene",   Lower.se_col = "Lower.se.RE",   Upper.se_col = "Upper.se.RE",   letters_col = "sig",   legend_position = "none") # more controlling arguments are available.

title: Manual
text: function plotSingleGene() creates bar plot relative gene expression (fold change) values single gene analysis showing pairwise significances.
code: res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data_Heffer2020PlosOne,   numOfFactors = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL,   analyseAllTarget = "Tnfa")   plotSingleGene(res, fill = "cyan4", color = "black", base_size = 12)

title: Manual
text: Although expression analysis functions perform statistical comparisons levels analysed factor, post-hoc analysis still possible. Means_DDCt function performs post-hoc comparisons using fitted model object produced ANOVA_DCt ANOVA_DDCt. applies pairwise statistical comparisons relative expression (RE) values user-specified effects via specs argument. Supported effects include simple effects, interactions, slicing, provided underlying model ANOVA. ANCOVA models returned package, Means_DDCt output limited simple effects .
code: res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data_3factor,   numOfFactors = 3,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL)  model <- res$perGene$E_PO$lm # Relative expression values for Concentration main effect Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc")  # contrast        RE        SE df       LCL       UCL p.value sig # L vs H   0.1703610 0.2208988 24 0.1242014 0.2336757 <0.0001 *** # M vs H   0.2227247 0.2208988 24 0.1623772 0.3055004 <0.0001 *** # M vs L   1.3073692 0.2208988 24 0.9531359 1.7932535  0.0928 .   # #Results are averaged over the levels of: Type, SA  #Confidence level used: 0.95   # Relative expression values for Concentration sliced by Type Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc | Type")  #Type = R: # contrast       RE        SE df       LCL      UCL p.value sig # L vs H   0.103187 0.3123981 24 0.0659984 0.161331 <0.0001 *** # M vs H   0.339151 0.3123981 24 0.2169210 0.530255 <0.0001 *** # M vs L   3.286761 0.3123981 24 2.1022126 5.138776 <0.0001 *** # #Type = S: # contrast       RE        SE df       LCL      UCL p.value sig # L vs H   0.281265 0.3123981 24 0.1798969 0.439751 <0.0001 *** # M vs H   0.146266 0.3123981 24 0.0935518 0.228684 <0.0001 *** # M vs L   0.520030 0.3123981 24 0.3326112 0.813055  0.0059 **  # #Results are averaged over the levels of: SA  #Confidence level used: 0.95   # Relative expression values for Concentration sliced by Type and SA Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc | Type * SA")

title: Manual
text: residuals t.test lm object normally distributed, significance results might violated. cases, non-parametric tests can used. example, Mann–Whitney test - also known Wilcoxon rank-sum test, (implemented via WILCOX_DDCt() rtpcr package), alternative t.test, kruskal.test() alternative one-way analysis variance. tests assess differences population medians using independent groups. However, t.test function (also TTEST_DDCt function described ) includes var.equal argument. set FALSE, performs t.test unequal variances hypothesis. Residuals ANOVA_DCt ANOVA_DDCt functions objects can extracted lmand plotted follow:
code: data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_repeated_measure_1.csv", package = "rtpcr")) res3 <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL,   model = wDCt ~ time + (1 | id) )  residuals <- resid(res3$perGene$Target$lm) shapiro.test(residuals)  par(mfrow = c(1,2)) plot(residuals) qqnorm(residuals) qqline(residuals, col = "red")

title: Calculation method
text: basic method estimating gene expression conditions relies calculating fold differences using PCR amplification efficiency (EE) threshold cycle (also called crossing point, CtC_t). Among various approaches analyzing real-time PCR data, Livak method—also known 2−ΔΔCt2^{-\Delta\Delta C_t} method—widely used simplicity reliability. method, fold change (FC) expression, 2−ΔΔCt2^{-\Delta\Delta C_t}, Treatment (Tr) group relative Control (Co) group calculated follows: Fold change=2−ΔΔCt=2−(Ct,target−Ct,ref)Tr2−(Ct,target−Ct,ref)Co=2−[(Ct,target−Ct,ref)Tr−(Ct,target−Ct,ref)Co]=2−[(ΔCt)Tr−(ΔCt)Co]   \begin{align*} \text{Fold change} &= 2^{-\Delta\Delta C_t} \\ &= \frac{2^{-(C_{t,\text{target}} - C_{t,\text{ref}})_{\text{Tr}}}} {2^{-(C_{t,\text{target}} - C_{t,\text{ref}})_{\text{Co}}}} \\ &= 2^{-[(C_{t,\text{target}} - C_{t,\text{ref}})_{\text{Tr}}         - (C_{t,\text{target}} - C_{t,\text{ref}})_{\text{Co}}]} \\ &= 2^{-[(\Delta C_t)_{\text{Tr}} - (\Delta C_t)_{\text{Co}}]} \end{align*} , ΔCt\Delta C_t difference target Ct reference Ct values given sample. Livak method assumes target reference genes amplified efficiencies close 100%, allowing relative quantification gene expression levels. hand, Pfaffl method offers flexible approach accounting differences amplification efficiencies target reference genes. method adjusts calculated expression ratio incorporating specific amplification efficiencies, thus providing accurate representation relative gene expression levels. Fold change=Etarget−(Ct,Tr−Ct,Co)Eref−(Ct,Tr−Ct,Co)   \text{Fold change} =   \frac{E_{\text{target}}^{-(C_{t,\text{Tr}} - C_{t,\text{Co}})}} {E_{\text{ref}}^{-(C_{t,\text{Tr}} - C_{t,\text{Co}})}}

title: Calculation method
text: rtpcr package developed R environment major operating systems. package functions mainly based calculation efficiency-weighted ΔCt\Delta C_t(wΔCt)(w\Delta C_t) values target reference gene Ct (equation 3). wΔCtw\Delta C_t values weighted amplification efficiencies described Ganger et al. (2017) except log2 used instead log10: wΔCt=log2(Etarget)⋅Ct,target−log2(Eref)⋅Ct,ref   w\Delta C_t =   \log_2(E_{\text{target}}) \cdot C_{t,\text{target}} -   \log_2(E_{\text{ref}}) \cdot C_{t,\text{ref}}  one reference gene, log2E.Ct term references, whole wDCt defined using geometric mean follow: wCt=log2(Etarget)⋅Cttarget−(∏=1n[log2(geoMeanE)⋅Ctrefi])1/n wCt = \log_{2}\!\left(E_{\text{target}}\right)\cdot Ct_{\text{target}} - \left( \prod_{=1}^{n} \left[ \log_{2}\!\left(\text{geoMeanE}\right)\cdot Ct_{\text{ref}_i} \right] \right)^{1/n}  geometric mean efficieny values referene genes : geoMeanE=(∏=1nErefi)1/n \text{geoMeanE} = \left( \prod_{=1}^{n} E_{\text{ref}_i} \right)^{1/n} relative expression target gene normalized reference gene(s) within sample condition called relative expression (RE). mean wΔCtw\Delta C_t values biological replicates, RE target gene can calculated condition according equation Relative Expression=2−wΔCt¯   \text{Relative Expression} = 2^{-\overline{w\Delta C_t}} Relative expression calibrated reference gene(s) control condition. However, often one condition considered calibrator fold change (FC) expression conditions calculated relative calibrator. Examples Treatment versus Control Control served calibrator, time 0 versus time 1 (e.g. 1 hour) time 2 (e.g. 2 hours) time 0 served reference calibrator level. , calibrator reference level sample others compared . fold change (FC) expression target gene reference calibrator level 1 changed compared . fold change expression target gene due treatment can calculated follows: Fold Change due Treatment=2−(wΔCt¯Tr−wΔCt¯Co)   \text{Fold Change due Treatment} =   2^{-(\overline{w\Delta C_t}_{\text{Tr}} - \overline{w\Delta C_t}_{\text{Co}})} Standard error FC RE means calculated according Taylor et al. (2019) rtpcr package. , brief methodology presented details wΔCtw\Delta C_t calculations statistical analysis available Ganger et al. (2017). Importantly, relative expression values follow lognormal distribution, normal distribution expected wΔCtw \Delta C_t values making possible apply t-test analysis variance. Following analysis, wΔCtw\Delta C_t values statistically compared standard deviations confidence interval calculated, transformation y=2−xy = 2^{-x} applied final step order report results.

However, optional custom model formula character string can supplied functions. provided, overrides default formula (uni- multi-factorial CRD RCBD design). formula uses wDCt response variable (wDCt automatically created function). mixed models, include random effects using lmer syntax (e.g., wDCt ~ Treatment + (1 | id)). sample common models can used.

title: qPCR Data Analysis
text: CRD, RCBD, factorial experiments arranged either CRD RCBD designs, need explicitly define model. package automatically selects appropriate model based provided arguments. model specified, default model used printed along output expression table.

title: qPCR Data Analysis
text: Sometime groups independent paired (Repeated measure experiments). Examples: 1) Analyzing gene expression different time points, treatment biological replicate; 2) Analyzing gene expression two tissue types within organism. analysis types, two time points, can use TTEST_DDCt argument paired = TRUE; ANOVA_DDCt (two time points) repeated measure model wDCt ~ Treatment + ( 1 | id) wDCt ~ Treatment + ( 1 | Rep). Figure 5: Calculation standard error (se) ddCt–based relative expression ANOVA_DDCt() function rtpcr package. schematic illustrates weighted dCt (wdCt) weighted ddCt (wddCt) values combined different experimental designs, standard error computed depending se.type argument (One “paired.group”, “two.group”, “single.group”). “paired.group” computes se paired differences (used random id effect present), “two.group” uses unpaired two-group t-test standard error reference level, “single.group” computes se within level using one-group t-test. independent groups, ANOVA_DDCt() automatically uses se.type = “two.group”, repeated‐measure paired designs model specified, ANOVA_DDCt() automatically selects se.type = “paired.group”

title: qPCR Data Analysis
text: Relative expression analysis can done using ΔΔCt\Delta\Delta Ct ΔCt\Delta Ct methods different functions (.e. TTEST_DDCt, WILCOX_DDCt, ANOVA_DDCt(), ANOVA_DCt()). examples expression analysis using ΔΔCt\Delta\Delta Ct method.
code: data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_Yuan2006PMCBioinf.csv", package = "rtpcr")) data  # Anova analysis ANOVA_DDCt(   data,   mainFactor.column = 1,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL)  # An example of a properly arranged dataset from a repeated-measures experiment. data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_repeated_measure_1.csv", package = "rtpcr")) data  # time  id  E_Target    Ct_target   E_Ref      Ct_Ref #    1   1      2       18.92   2   32.77 #    1   2      2       15.82   2   32.45 #    1   3      2       19.84   2   31.62 #    2   1      2       19.46   2   33.03 #    2   2      2       17.56   2   33.24 #    2   3      2       19.74   2   32.08 #    3   1      2       15.73   2   32.95 #    3   2      2       17.21   2   33.64 #    3   3      2       18.09   2   33.40  # Repeated measure analysis res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL, model = wDCt ~ time + (1 | id))   # Paired t.test (equivalent to repeated measure analysis, but not always the same results, due to different calculation methods!) TTEST_DDCt(   data[1:6,],    numberOfrefGenes = 1,    paired = T)   # Anova analysis data3 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_2factorBlock3ref.csv", package = "rtpcr"))  res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   x = data3,   mainFactor.column = 2,   numOfFactors = 2,   numberOfrefGenes = 3,   block = "block",   analyseAllTarget = TRUE)

title: qPCR Data Analysis
text: Although expression analysis functions perform statistical comparisons levels analysed factor, post-hoc analysis still possible. Means_DDCt function performs post-hoc comparisons using fitted model object produced ANOVA_DCt ANOVA_DDCt. applies pairwise statistical comparisons relative expression (RE) values user-specified effects via specs argument. Supported effects include simple effects, interactions, slicing, provided underlying model ANOVA. ANCOVA models returned package, Means_DDCt output limited simple effects .
code: res <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data_3factor,   numOfFactors = 3,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL)  model <- res$perGene$E_PO$lm # Relative expression values for Concentration main effect Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc")  # contrast        RE        SE df       LCL       UCL p.value sig # L vs H   0.1703610 0.2208988 24 0.1242014 0.2336757 <0.0001 *** # M vs H   0.2227247 0.2208988 24 0.1623772 0.3055004 <0.0001 *** # M vs L   1.3073692 0.2208988 24 0.9531359 1.7932535  0.0928 .   # #Results are averaged over the levels of: Type, SA  #Confidence level used: 0.95   # Relative expression values for Concentration sliced by Type Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc | Type")  # Type = R: #  contrast       RE        SE df       LCL      UCL p.value sig #  L vs H   0.103187 0.3123981 24 0.0659984 0.161331 <0.0001 *** #  M vs H   0.339151 0.3123981 24 0.2169210 0.530255 <0.0001 *** #  M vs L   3.286761 0.3123981 24 2.1022126 5.138776 <0.0001 *** # # Type = S: #  contrast       RE        SE df       LCL      UCL p.value sig #  L vs H   0.281265 0.3123981 24 0.1798969 0.439751 <0.0001 *** #  M vs H   0.146266 0.3123981 24 0.0935518 0.228684 <0.0001 *** #  M vs L   0.520030 0.3123981 24 0.3326112 0.813055  0.0059 **  # # Results are averaged over the levels of: SA  # Confidence level used: 0.95   # Relative expression values for Concentration sliced by Type and SA Means_DDCt(model, specs = "Conc | Type * SA")

title: qPCR Data Analysis
text: residuals t.test lm object normally distributed, significance results might violated. cases, non-parametric tests can used. example, Mann–Whitney test - also known Wilcoxon rank-sum test, (implemented via WILCOX_DDCt() rtpcr package), alternative t.test, kruskal.test() alternative one-way analysis variance. tests assess differences population medians using independent groups. However, t.test function (also TTEST_DDCt function described ) includes var.equal argument. set FALSE, performs t.test unequal variances hypothesis. Residuals ANOVA_DCt ANOVA_DDCt functions objects can extracted lmand plotted follow:
code: data <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_repeated_measure_1.csv", package = "rtpcr")) res3 <- ANOVA_DDCt(   data,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   mainFactor.column = 1,   block = NULL,   model = wDCt ~ time + (1 | id) ) residuals <- resid(res3$perGene$Target$lm) shapiro.test(residuals)  par(mfrow = c(1,2)) plot(residuals) qqnorm(residuals) qqline(residuals, col = "red")

title: Delta Ct ANOVA analysis with optional model specification — ANOVA_DCt
text: x input data frame containing experimental design columns, target gene E/Ct column pairs, reference gene E/Ct column pairs. Reference gene columns must located end data frame. See "Input data structure" vignettes details data structure. numOfFactors Integer. Number experimental factor columns (excluding rep optional block). numberOfrefGenes Integer. Number reference genes. reference gene must represented two columns (E Ct). block Character. Block column name NULL. qPCR experiment done multiple qPCR plates, variation resulting plates may interfere actual amount gene expression. One solution conduct plate randomized block least one replicate treatment control present plate. Block effect usually considered random interaction main effect considered. Note: parameter ignored model provided. alpha Statistical level comparisons (default: 0.05). p.adj Method p-value adjustment. See p.adjust. analyseAllTarget Logical character. TRUE (default), detected target genes analysed. Alternatively, character vector specifying names (names Efficiency columns) target genes analysed. model Optional model formula. provided, overrides automatic formula (CRD RCBD based block numOfFactors). formula uses wDCt response variable. mixed models, random effects can defined using lmer syntax (e.g., "wDCt ~ Treatment + (1|Block)"). using model, block numOfFactors arguments ignored model specification, still used data structure identification. set_missing_target_Ct_to_40 TRUE, missing target gene Ct values become 40; FALSE (default), become NA.

title: Delta Ct ANOVA analysis with optional model specification — ANOVA_DCt
text: function performs ANOVA analysis weighted delta Ct (wDCt) values returns variance components along expression table containing: gene: Name target genes Factor columns: Experimental design factors dCt: Mean weighted delta Ct treatment combination RE: Relative expression = 2^-dCt log2FC: log2 relative expression LCL: 95% lower confidence level UCL: 95% upper confidence level se: Standard error mean calculated wDCt values Lower.se.RE: Lower limit error bar RE (2^(log2(RE) - se)) Upper.se.RE: Upper limit error bar RE (2^(log2(RE) + se)) Lower.se.log2FC: Lower limit error bar log2 RE Upper.se.log2FC: Upper limit error bar log2 RE sig: Per-gene significance grouping letters

title: Delta Delta Ct ANOVA analysis with optional model specification — ANOVA_DDCt
text: x input data frame containing experimental design columns, replicates (integer), target gene E/Ct column pairs, reference gene E/Ct column pairs. Reference gene columns must located right end data frame. See "Input data structure" vignettes details data structure. numOfFactors Integer. Number experimental factor columns (excluding rep optional block). numberOfrefGenes Integer. Number reference genes. mainFactor.column Integer. Column index factor relative expression analysis applied. block Character. Block column name NULL. qPCR experiment done multiple qPCR plates, variation resulting plates may interfere actual amount gene expression. One solution conduct plate randomized block least one replicate treatment control present plate. Block effect usually considered random interaction main effect considered. mainFactor.level.order Optional character vector specifying order levels main factor. NULL, first observed level used calibrator. provided, first element vector used calibrator level. p.adj Method p-value adjustment. See p.adjust. analyseAllTarget Logical character. TRUE (default), target genes analysed. Alternatively, character vector specifying names (names Efficiency columns) target genes analysed. model Optional model formula. provided, overrides automatic formula (uni - multi-factorial CRD RCBD based block numOfFactors). formula uses wDCt response variable. mixed models, random effects can defined using lmer syntax (e.g., "wDCt ~ Treatment + (1 | id)"). using model, block numOfFactors arguments ignored model specification, still used data structure identification. fixed effects , "lm" (ordinary least squares) used. "lmer" used mixed effects models (requires lmerTest package). custom formula provided random effects, function use lmerTest::lmer(); otherwise use stats::lm(). Note emmeans supports model types use appropriate degrees freedom methods (Satterthwaite default). set_missing_target_Ct_to_40 TRUE, missing target gene Ct values become 40; FALSE (default), become NA. se.type Character string specifying standard error calculated. One "paired.group", "two.group", "single.group". "paired.group" computes SE paired differences (used random id effect present), "two.group" uses unpaired two-group t-test standard error reference level, "single.group" computes SE within level using one-group t-test.

code: compute_wDCt(   x,   numOfFactors,   numberOfrefGenes,   block,   set_missing_target_Ct_to_40 = FALSE )

title: Cleaning data and weighted delta Ct (wDCt) calculation — compute_wDCt
text: x data frame containing experimental design columns, replicates (integer), target gene E/Ct column pairs, reference gene E/Ct column pairs. Reference gene columns must located end data frame. numOfFactors Integer. Number experimental factor columns (excluding rep optional block). numberOfrefGenes Integer. Number reference genes. block Character NULL. Name blocking factor column. qPCR experiment done multiple qPCR plates, plate considered random block least one replicate treatment control present plate. set_missing_target_Ct_to_40 TRUE, missing target gene Ct values become 40; FALSE (default), become NA.

title: Cleaning data and weighted delta Ct (wDCt) calculation — compute_wDCt
text: original data frame along weighted delta Ct column.

title: Cleaning data and weighted delta Ct (wDCt) calculation — compute_wDCt
text: compute_wDCt function computes weighted delta Ct (wDCt) input data. Missing data can denoted NA input data frame. Values '0' 'undetermined' (E Ct) automatically converted NA. target genes, NA E Ct measurements cause returning NA corresponding delta Ct replicate (row). one reference gene, NA place E Ct value cause skipping gene remaining references geometrically averaged. compute_wDCt function automatically applied expression analysis functions.

what: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
text: Performs relative expression (fold change) analysis based Delta Delta Ct (ddCt) methods using fitted model object produced ANOVA_DCt() ANOVA_DDCt().

title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
code: Means_DDCt(model, specs, p.adj = "none")

title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
text: model fitted model object (typically lmer lm object) created ANOVA_DCt(), ANOVA_DDCt(). specs character string character vector specifying predictors combinations predictors relative expression values desired. argument follows specification syntax used emmeans::emmeans() (e.g., "Factor", "Factor1 | Factor2"). p.adj Character string specifying method adjusting p-values. See p.adjust available options.

title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
text: data frame containing estimated relative expression values, confidence intervals, p-values, significance levels derived fitted model.

title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt
text: Means_DDCt function performs pairwise comparisons relative expression values fo combinations using estimated marginal means derived fitted model. ANOVA models, relative expression values can obtained main effects, interactions, sliced (simple) effects. ANCOVA models returned rtpcr package, simple effects supported. Internally, function relies emmeans package compute marginal means contrasts, back-transformed fold change values using ddCt framework.

title: Delta Delta Ct pairwise comparisons using a fitted model — Means_DDCt

code: # Example using output from TTEST_DDCt data1 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_ttest18genes.csv", package = "rtpcr")) out <- TTEST_DDCt(   data1,   paired = FALSE,   var.equal = TRUE,   numberOfrefGenes = 1) #> *** 18 target(s) using 1 reference gene(s) was analysed! #> *** The Control level was used as calibrator.    p1 <- plotFactor(out,    x_col = "gene",   y_col = "log2FC",    Lower.se_col = "Lower.se.log2FC",   Upper.se_col = "Upper.se.log2FC",    letters_col = "sig")    p2 <- plotFactor(out,    x_col = "gene",   y_col = "RE",    Lower.se_col = "Lower.se.RE",   Upper.se_col = "Upper.se.RE",    letters_col = "sig")        # Example using output from ANOVA_DCt data2 <- read.csv(system.file("extdata", "data_1factor.csv", package = "rtpcr")) out2 <- ANOVA_DCt(   data2,   numOfFactors = 1,   numberOfrefGenes = 1,   block = NULL) #>  #> Relative Expression #>  #>   gene SA     dCt      RE   log2FC     LCL     UCL      se Lower.se.RE #> 1   PO L1 1.81000 0.28519 -1.81000 0.18404 0.44193 0.02082     0.28111 #> 2   PO L2 0.67333 0.62706 -0.67333 0.40466 0.97167 0.43880     0.46261 #> 3   PO L3 0.01667 0.98851 -0.01667 0.63792 1.53178 0.08413     0.93252 #>   Upper.se.RE Upper.se.log2FC Lower.se.log2FC sig #> 1     0.28934        -1.78407        -1.83631   a #> 2     0.84996        -0.49675        -0.91269   a #> 3     1.04787        -0.01572        -0.01767   b #>  #> Note: Using default model for statistical analysis: wDCt ~ SA     df <- out2$relativeExpression  p3 <- plotFactor(   df,   x_col = "SA",   y_col = "RE",   Lower.se_col = "Lower.se.RE",   Upper.se_col = "Upper.se.RE",   letters_col = "sig",   letters_d = 0.1,   col_width = 0.7,   err_width = 0.15,   fill_colors = "skyblue",   alpha = 1,   base_size = 14)  # Combine plots into a single layout multiplot(p1, p2, cols = 2)   multiplot(p1, p3, cols = 2)

title: rtpcr 2.1.4
text: ANOVA_DDCt() function se.type argument added control standard errors (SE) calculated relative expression (RE = fold change) estimates. "paired.sample": computes SE paired differences factor levels, matching samples id. automatically used id random effect detected mixed model. "two.sample": computes SE using unpaired samples reference level. "single.sample": computes SE within factor level. Standard error calculations now correctly respect repeated-measures designs id random effect present user-specified model. Paired SEs calculated strictly matching observations id, improving accuracy longitudinal paired experimental designs. SE calculations now robust missing values relying t.test() internals. random id effect detected model, paired standard errors used automatically (warning another se.type requested). reference level always assigned SE zero consistency fold-change reporting. function called plotSingleGene() added creates bar plot relative gene expression (fold change) values single gene analysis showing pairwise significances.
